macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indexes Decline on Mixed Earnings; S&P 500 Down 0.2%, Dow Drops 0.8%
items.summary: Wall Street pulled back from records on January 13, 2026, with the S&P 500 falling 13.53 points (0.2%) to 6,963.74, Dow Jones dropping 398.21 points (0.8%) to 49,191.99, and Nasdaq slipping 0.1% to 23,709.87 amid mixed bank profits like JPMorgan Chase.

items.title: Treasury Yields Ease as Inflation Data Boosts Fed Rate Cut Expectations for 2026
items.summary: US inflation update met expectations, lowering Treasury yields and strengthening views of at least two Federal Reserve rate cuts in 2026 to support the job market; consumer inflation stalled at 2.7% y/y.

items.title: Moderna Shares Surge 17.1% on Strong 2025 Revenue Outlook and Product Updates
items.summary: Moderna led S&P 500 gains, jumping 17.1% after forecasting 2025 revenue above its November midpoint and providing updates on products including a seasonal flu vaccine.

items.title: Asian Markets Mixed; Japan's Nikkei Surges 1.6% Amid Election Speculation
items.summary: Asian benchmarks traded mixed after US pullback, with Australia's S&P/ASX 200 down 0.1% and Japan's Nikkei 225 up 1.6% to 54,413.92 on potential early elections.

items.title: Upcoming US PPI, Retail Sales, and Bank Earnings to Drive Volatility on January 14
items.summary: Key US data releases including Producer Price Index (PPI) and retail sales, alongside earnings from Citigroup, Wells Fargo, and Bank of America, expected to influence S&P 500 and global markets.

items.title: USD Faces Downside Pressure Amid Stabilizing Inflation and Fed Independence Concerns
items.summary: USD index rose 0.3% after December CPI at 2.7% y/y, but stabilizing core inflation at 2.6% y/y and worries over Fed Chair Powell probe sustain downside risks; Supreme Court tariff ruling awaited.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Breaks Key Resistance at $94.5K, Peaks Near $96K with 4.5% Daily Gain
items.summary: Bitcoin surged above $95,500, driven by cooling U.S. inflation data, rate-cut expectations, and positive regulatory momentum, pushing total market cap toward $3.25 trillion. Crypto Fear & Greed Index rose to 48 from 26.

items.title: Privacy Tokens Surge: Monero Hits All-Time High of $692, Dash Up Over 30%
items.summary: Monero (XMR) reached a new ATH of $692, up 10% in 24 hours and 50% weekly, entering top 20 cryptos; Dash led gainers with 30%+ rise amid privacy sector rotation including DCR, STRK, ZEN.

items.title: CLARITY Act Gains Momentum in U.S., Clarifying SEC-CFTC Roles for Crypto
items.summary: Lawmakers advanced the Digital Asset Market Clarity Act of 2025, boosting regulatory sentiment and supporting crypto price gains amid easing inflation and shifting Fed rate expectations.

items.title: Polygon Labs Acquires Coinme and Sequence for Over $250 Million
items.summary: Polygon Labs bolstered its stablecoin and on-chain payments capabilities with major acquisitions of crypto startups Coinme and Sequence, signaling a shift beyond scaling solutions.

items.title: zkSync Unveils 2026 Roadmap with Prividium Privacy and ZKStack
items.summary: zkSync released its 2026 roadmap emphasizing Prividium for bank-grade privacy, ZKStack for coordinated systems, and Airbender as a universal ZK standard.

items.title: PancakeSwap Proposes Reducing CAKE Max Supply to 400 Million
items.summary: PancakeSwap suggested cutting CAKE's maximum supply from 450 million to 400 million tokens amid project updates.

items.title: Coinbase to List Raydium (RAY) for Spot Trading
items.summary: Coinbase announced listing of Raydium (RAY) for spot trading, highlighting notable project developments.

items.title: Thailand Tightens Crypto Regulations with Travel Rule and Wallet Verification
items.summary: Thailand enhanced digital asset rules, mandating Travel Rule compliance and wallet-to-wallet identity checks, while planning a national data bureau.

items.title: Bitwise Survey: Financial Advisors' Crypto Allocations Hit Record Highs in 2025
items.summary: Bitwise's annual survey revealed surging client crypto allocations among financial advisors, marking 2025 as a breakout year.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Materials Project Accelerates AI Revolution in Materials Science
items.summary: The Materials Project is enabling machine learning breakthroughs in materials discovery by providing high-quality curated data for training AI models, with collaborations like Google DeepMind adding 400,000 compounds and integration with Berkeley Lab’s A-Lab for autonomous experiments.

items.title: AI Model Reveals Strategies to Improve Cancer Outcomes Worldwide
items.summary: A new AI model identifies specific ways every country can enhance its cancer outcomes, marking the first such comprehensive global analysis.

items.title: AI Emerges as Revolutionary Tool for Global Farming Productivity
items.summary: AI combined with data and expertise—termed 'agricultural intelligence'—is transforming precision farming, plant breeding, and digital management across 70 million hectares via platforms like Syngenta’s Cropwise, though challenges like digital divides persist.
items.source: Genetic Literacy Project / World Economic Forum

items.title: 2026 AI Risks: Agentic AI as New Insider Threat and Critical Thinking Atrophy
items.summary: Experts highlight 2026 AI red flags including autonomous agents posing insider risks, over-reliance causing human skill atrophy, identity erosion, and persistent issues like energy use and bias.

items.title: 2026 Preview: Surging AI Regulations and Cyber Risks Ahead
items.summary: Businesses face complex AI regulations in 2026, including state laws, Trump Administration clashes, FDA/HHS pilots in healthcare, and rising AI-enabled cyberattacks.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Meta Cuts 1,500 Reality Labs Jobs and Closes Major VR Game Studios
items.summary: Meta is laying off 10% of its Reality Labs division (approximately 1,500 employees) and shutting down four first-party game development studios including Armature Studios, Sanzaru Games, Twisted Pixel, and Within. The studios were responsible for popular VR titles like Deadpool VR, Asgard's Wrath 2, Supernatural, and Resident Evil 4 VR.

items.title: Games Workshop Bans AI Use in Design Processes
items.summary: Wargaming miniatures giant Games Workshop has implemented a ban on AI use in its design processes, with CEO Kevin Rountree emphasizing the company's stance against artificial intelligence in creative development.

items.title: India's Gaming Industry Seeks Tax Parity and IP Funding Ahead of Budget 2026
items.summary: Indian gaming and esports stakeholders are calling for formal recognition of esports as a sport, dedicated funding for original game IP under the AVGC framework, and relief from banking restrictions as the government prepares its 2026 budget.

items.title: IGT Expands Andy Hendrickson's Role to Chief Product & Technology Officer
items.summary: International Game Technology (IGT) has announced an expanded role for executive Andy Hendrickson as Chief Product & Technology Officer.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: FORVIA HELLA and NXP Collaborate on Advanced Radar Sensors at CES 2026
items.summary: FORVIA HELLA announced a partnership with NXP Semiconductors to develop and industrialize ForWave7HD high-resolution radar sensors featuring up to 32 transmission and receive channels, leveraging NXP's third-generation imaging radar chipset.

items.title: TEI Partners With Paren for EV Charging Data Analytics Program
items.summary: The Transportation Energy Institute's Charging Analytics Program announced a partnership with Paren, an EV charging data platform, to provide advanced analysis and insights on charging performance, utilization, and infrastructure planning across the market.

items.title: Polygon Labs Acquires Two Crypto Startups for $250 Million
items.summary: Polygon Labs purchased cash-to-crypto company Coinme and wallet infrastructure firm Sequence as part of its strategy to compete with Stripe in the blockchain space.

items.title: Strava Sets Sights on IPO Following CEO-Led Turnaround
items.summary: Under new CEO Mike Martin, fitness platform Strava has executed a turnaround strategy driven by Gen Z runners, strategic acquisitions, and global expansion, positioning itself for a potential initial public offering.
